page.title: 09INDUSTRY IN CATFIELD
page.content: Catfield is a working village. It is the home of both established rural companies and new businesses. Neave's coach firm is based in the centre of the village. The firm has recently taken over council bus routes as the rural services decline. Mixers manufacture mobile buildings while Horizon Craft next door build holiday cruisers. Seamans the corn merchants have a depot next to the mushroom farm. Units on the new industrial estate are operated by Stalham Joinery and a packing tray company. Another site is owned by Sea and Land Pipes. Threeways garage is only a service garage now, but batteries, exhausts and tyres can be bought at one of the estate units. Seasonal work picking sprouts and onions is also carried out.
